FBL-6387:Company Structure import with users corrupts existing Viewpoint users

comments.author: Kevin Lawlor
comments.comment:
The only pedantic comment I'd make here is to tie it in with the description of the SecurityGroupName. for example:
This property represents the name of the group under which employer viewpoint users reside. Its use differs depending on the company structure. In the case of a single service company setup, one which manages both security and workflow, all employer viewpoint users will be maintained here. In the case of a split servicing company, this property represents the group under which all employer viewpoint users will be added under the workflow servicing company.

comments.author: Robert Treacy
comments.comment:
Personally I would have put the "Plan selection by reason" test code in a new class
1. With the volume of code helps to separate the existing test code from the new test code, class is getting very large and hard to navigate 2. There is a posibility that additional tests will be added to this class which which further complicate the class

comments.author: Hugo Dias
comments.comment: Are all these attributes to be used in All tests? If not, transform them to local variables.

comments.author: Brian Cowzer
comments.comment: removed in later commit

comments.author: Filipe Rodrigues
comments.comment:
Looking at this it might make sense to enhance the OCCaseForServiceAgreementBuilder to be able to create all the structure under the SA by default, instead of creating it from outside of the builder.
It could create the serviceDetails and the serviceProvided to the absence management by default and go from there.
Or maybe we need a different kind of builder, one that builds us different kinds of scenarios according to the configuration that we pass to the builder.

comments.author: Robert Treacy
comments.comment: Could you have created a helper method which takes in a list of ServiceProvided and sets the ServiceProvided accordingly as the paramaters for the ServiceProvided remain constant

comments.author: Robert Treacy
comments.comment:
Should we add a few additional tests (Not sure if these scenarios are already covered by the 4 test scenarios)
1. To ensure that if there are no employer leave plans and there are statutory leave plans that all works ok
2. To ensure that if there are employer leave plans and there are no statutory leave plans that all works ok
3. To ensure that if there are no leave plans (employer or statutory) related to the passed in service agreement and ansence reason (Is this scenario possible)

comments.author: Brian Cowzer
comments.comment: think these are covered by existing tests

comments.author: Hugo Dias

comments.comment: In Java 7 you don't need to explicitly specify the type in the hashset.

comments.author: Filipe Rodrigues
comments.comment: I dont think we should expose the absence management service from the builder. We know that the SA will have the absence management service, so we should just get it from the SA itself.

comments.comment: Why is one called SampleSelectedLeavePlanListviewWidget and the other called SampleLeaveRequestPage? Pick a standard and stick with it. Rename one of these so they follow the same naming convention (of location of "Sample"). Rename tests also.

comments.author: Trevor Higgins
comments.comment:
I dont like catching GenericUncheckedException here.
TODO: refractor as soon the adt and restriction test page disappears.
I dont think the page going to disappear now? This is becoming a mess with ADT test page IMO. There is code commented out in LeavePlanAdjudicationService.runPlanAdjudication() due to this as well. We need to revisit what is the purpose of this page. My understanding is that it was just to display ADTs. It seems to still be about running adjudication which is not what was previously agreed (I believe), for this reason - that there would be meyy code and "run fake adjudication" vs "run real adjudication".

comments.comment: Expecting a null pointer is not a good idea. This could come from something other than leavePlanAdjudicationService.deleteExistingAdjudicationResults(leaveRequest); and you would never know. Change the expectation to throw GenericUncheckedException and expect that in the test annotation.
